question: What is water radiolysis?
ideal_answer: Water radiolysis involves chemical decomposition of the water molecule into free radicals after exposure to ionizing radiation. These free radicals have deleterious effects on normal cell physiology.

snippets.text: Water radiolysis involves chemical decomposition of the water molecule into free radicals after exposure to ionizing radiation. These free radicals have deleterious effects on normal cell physiology.
Electron Nuclear Dynamics Simulations of Proton Cancer Therapy Reactions: Water Radiolysis
simulate water radiolysis reactions-i.e. the PCT processes that generate the DNA-damaging species against cancerous cells.
